result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont R Emrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont R Emrick

records.addlTxt: Return to sender - Not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward. Notice of Hearing ( 09-09-2022)

9:55 AM Defendant Lamont R Emrick in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Lamont R Emrick.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Victim present in court. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 21CF1177 Cts 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6- GUILTY. 
20CM473 Ct 1- GUILTY. 
20CM30 Ct 1- GUILTY. 
22CM474 Ct 1- GUILTY.  
20CM1320 Ct 1- GUILTY. 
20CM928 Ct 1- GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaints. 
BTC: 20CM473 Ct 1 GUILTY with remaining dismissed and read in. 20CM30 Ct 1 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 22CM474 Ct 1 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 20CM1320 Ct 1 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 20CM928 Ct 1 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
Sentence withheld. 
2 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Medication assisted treatment allowed. 
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with the victim or any member of his family. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Obtain GED or HSED. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge+ Domestic Abuse Surcharge

20CM473- 15 days Racine County Jail. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge+ Domestic Abuse Surcharge, payment plan $25/month commencing 11/1/2022.

20CM1320 -15 days Racine County Jail consecutive to 20CM473. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge, added to payment plan. 

22CM474-15 days Racine County Jail consecutive to 20CM1320. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge, added to payment plan.

20CM30-15 days Racine County Jail consecutive to 22CM474. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge, added to payment plan.

20CM928- 15 days Racine County Jail consecutive to 20CM30.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge, added to payment plan.
Order to Consolidate
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Stipulation and Order to Consolidate
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:40 AM Defendant Lamont R Emrick in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Lamont R Emrick.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense has received an offer from the State. Looking to consolidate the cases. Make statements on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim D.C (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

AMENDED 7/7/22 to allow no violent contact with C.M. or D.H.

2:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lamont R Emrick in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Lamont R Emrick. Court Reporter: Saige Smith.  
Defense is seeking to modify the bonds in the five misdemeanor files. Seeking for $100 cash bond in each case as well as bond conditions to be modified to allow no violent contact with victim. 
Victim C.M. is present in court and gives statement as to bond conditions modification request.  
State does not object to bond modification requests and does not object to lowering the cash bonds in each case. 
BTC: Cash bond modified to $100 in each file. Bond conditions modified to no violent contact with C.M or D.H. Matter set over. 
Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defense's

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lamont R Emrick in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Lamont R Emrick. Court Reporter: Donna Moore. 
Matter set to address Defense's bond motion. 
Defense requests bond be modified to $100 cash on each file and gives statement as to why.
State objects to bond modification and gives statement as to why. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: DENIED.
for modification of bond
